subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... In fact, Java isn t interpreted anymore. And compute-intensive applications are probably a rather easy target for the hotspot engine... Take care, Ilja
messageBody:
Ron Jeffries wrote:
> On Wednesday, September 24, 2003, at 9:07:09 AM, Jim Dixon wrote:

>> This rule should not be true in compute-intensive applications -- but
>> the more compute-bound the problem, the less likely that Java is to
>> be used.
>
> Yes, but this is more a function of its interpretive nature
> than the length of the names, I would expect. And somewhere I
> believe I saw a case where C# beat C++ on some benchmark. And
> I have seen Smalltalk beat C++ as well.

In fact, Java isn't interpreted anymore. And compute-intensive
applications are probably a rather easy target for the hotspot engine...

Take care, Ilja
